intro: Pavetta arborescens, commonly known as the tree pavetta, is a tropical shrub or small tree native to Africa and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers. It produces small, fleshy fruits that are edible and often consumed by various wildlife species. Pavetta arborescens is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
